verse:
त एवं सुविनिर्णीय धर्मं भागवतं नृप ।
तं याम्यपाशान्निर्मुच्य विप्रं मृत्योरमूमुचन् ॥

terms.te: they (the order carriers of Lord Viṣṇu)
terms.yāmya-pāśāt: from the bondage of the order carriers of Yamarāja

vedabase.translation: Śrī Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued: My dear King, having thus perfectly judged the principles of devotional service with reasoning and arguments, the order carriers of Lord Viṣṇu released the brāhmaṇa Ajāmila from the bondage of the Yamadūtas and saved him from imminent death.

terms.याम्यपाशान्: the noose of Yama (the God of Death)

gpt.meaning: The verse further emphasizes that by performing these duties diligently, one can free the learned ones (like priests) from the clutches of death. This implies that by fulfilling our responsibilities and leading a virtuous life, we can ensure the protection and well being of those who guide us in our spiritual journey.

bard.meaning: Śrī Śuka said: Thus, very well considering devotional religion, O king, you will be freed from the snare of death, being released free from death.
